node.title: LetsDisc - Create Question, Upvotes and more
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
#### Repository

https://github.com/codingdefined/LetsDisc

For this Development Post I have worked on Pull Request - https://github.com/codingdefined/LetsDisc/pull/1

We see a lot of programming questions/answers pops up here and there. LetsDisc can solve the problem to keep everything on one place. One thing which will different for this project than other projects is that it will not be limited to Steem Users, you can login via any medium. Though you will have an option to Post on Steem. As of now you can Login, Register, Create/Edit Question, Upvote other users questions.

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmXAj11woaStQerBx7zWvFawro51KjgrN7baa8aBQVSDJk/image.png)

#### Features Implemented

Create/Edit Question - You can create your question with just title and body, your Body will have a preview which will show whatever you have written in the Body.

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmSxbE8CjczZrgY7LKHeqcsyrhLsYpyuLjCCjCqPSJSoAp/image.png)

Views and Upvotes - When someone views the questions, its view count increases though we keep track of that and the view will not increase if the same user again views the same question. Similarly for Upvotes and Downvotes we keep track of the user if he has upvotes/downvoted or not.

#### Technology Stack

1. .NET CORE 2.0
2. C#
4. JQuery
5. SQL
6. Entity Framework Core

The Project is based on https://aspnetboilerplate.com/, where the initial code is taken from it. More at https://steemit.com/utopian-io/@codingdefined/getting-started-with-aspnetboilerplate.

#### Roadmap

1. Adding Tags
2. Answering to Questions
3. Posting on Steem Blockchain if it not already posted
4. CodeRunner which will Run your Code In the Background once you post that either on Questions or Answers
5. Notifications
6. User's Page

#### How to contribute?

If you are contributing for Development, create a PR, either as a new feature or a bug fixing. 
If you have any idea or suggestion or have you encountered a bug, please create issue on github.

#### GitHub Account
https://github.com/codingdefined

node.title: One Month of Riding Experience of Suzuki Gixxer
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
I bought Suzuki Gixxer around 1 month back and till know ridden more than 750 kms, so I am in a good shape of writing a one month riding experience of my bike. 

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmUxXhMybgA9MvMWRh2BTrjhxWe3XdPnT7zy1Y5JoVipYD/image.png)

Before that I must say that I was searching for a bike for my budget for the last 6 months and the bikes which I was considering was Honda Hornet 160, Suzuki Gixxer 155 and Bajaj Pulsar 160 NS, thus I settled for Suzuki Gixxer after reading quite a good reviews of it. Along with the power the design of it is totally awesome. 

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmbQZvbdZjbuCEXv3Jv6n7ApbsakzKpEDnjJ4E3vdczMaR/image.png)

The handling of the bike is too good even though the riding position is slightly tipped-forward. Along with handling one think I must say that it is fuel efficient too with giving me around 50kmpl easily.

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQma4sBgZdJFYzywDrRrUHBx2U5FR8sF8egszbYvfsejZU5/image.png)

As of now the only problem I have faced is that the Bike's back Brake is not that great. You have to apply front brake everytime if you need to stop immediately. Pillion rider will have some discomfort as the pillion seat is narrower.

node.title: Are you living in Sync with Nature?
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
I was reading an article on the [speakingtree](https://timesofindia.speakingtree.in/article/live-in-sync-with-nature) whose title is Live in Sync with Nature. Now a simple question to each and everyone out there that are you living in Sync with the nature? According to Speakingtree, living in sync with nature simply means respecting the earth, other species who are living on earth as well as the environment you are living in. If you or anyone is not respecting the nature than it will be a doomsday for us. Though the article is apt owing to the current scenario where we are cutting down the forests in the name of development. Though development is needed but not on the sake of creating imbalance on the environment. Cutting down forests not only ncreases the global warning but also is bad for the environment as it is home for so many animals. We are heading to that day where only man will be living on earth with some oxygen cylinder on their back and no one else.
So please plant atleast a tree on your birthday, just as others planted for you you should plant for the sake of your children. We do cut a cake every year to celebrate our birthday so why not plant at least one tree every year and make a practice for the whole family. This way you are not only helping the environment but also educating your child the importance of environment. We have seen so many extinction of animals, what do you thing is the cause. The main cause of extinction is the environment imbalance and the animals who cannot stand it got extinct. Do you want your childs to see Tigers and Lions in the book and not in the zoo.

node.title: Thank you all Witnesses
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
As you all know that because of the simple bug in the Blockchain we have witnessed that Steem Blockchain was down or frozen for quite sometime.

The bug was that someone has started Power Down of Negative Vests and Blockchain was not checking that.

I was not going to discuss about the bug or something, but would like to Say thanks to all the witnesses who has helped the Blockchain to come online. They have worked really quick to find out the problem and rolled out the fix for everyone.

## Thank You Witnesses

node.title: Flash Light Making a Difference - Smartphone Photography
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
So I was just curious to know how flashlight of a mobile phone will make a difference if there is enough light to take pictures. It came out quite well, where we can see visual differences between the two. Though it was an evening where there was no sunlight, that means there would be sight changes though you can hardly find any difference in sunlight.

Do let me know which one you liked the most :) 

With Flash Light On

![image](https://img.esteem.ws/1ckmoeg4d0.jpg)

Without Flash Light

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/89g38nn0bc.jpg)

Camera : Nokia 6
